events.name: World Arduino Day 2017: Singapore edition
events.description:
For the fourth year, we are inviting all Arduino enthusiasts to join us in celebrating Arduino’s birthday on Saturday, April 1st!

Arduino Day is a 24-hour-long worldwide event where people interested in Arduino can get together, share their experiences, and learn more about the platform through all sorts of activities, tailored to local audiences. Participation is open to anyone, from young Makers and students to professional engineers and designers.

We are working to put together a line-up of activities e.g. workshops to help our participants learn and build their next cool projects with Arduino. 

NOTE:  All participants should come with their own laptop computer (Windows or MacOS) preferably pre-installed with the Arduino IDE (For more information, please refer to https://www.arduino.cc/en/Main/Software)

* Novice/Beginner's Workshop 10am-11am; 2pm-3pm (1 h):
* Arduino CTC 101 Educator Workshop 12pm-1pm; 3pm-4pm (1 hr)
* Maker Workshop (concurrent, whole day) 

Maker Workshops are payable on-site to the instructor before the session. More workshops will be added in due time:
* Infinity mirror
* Motion sensing robot
* 1Sheeld application
events.location: Prototyping Lab @ National Design Centre, , Singapore

events.name: Earn Extra Income with Certificate in Social Media Marketing
events.description:
Equip & Upgrade Yourself with Social Media Marketing Course 


Fully Sponsored by your $500 SkillsFuture Credits. 


Yes! That's Right, You do not need to fork out a single cent at all!





This is a course that you must take up if :


✅ You want to earn income through the social media


✅ You work in a Sales field, and deal with Business to Consumer (B2C) content


✅ You work in a communications-related field, and deal with Business to Consumer (B2C) content


✅ You want to start an online business and build an e-commerce site from scratch


✅ You want to learn valuable skills on how to generate sales leads from Facebook for your business/services.


✅ You want to learn how to get quality leads through the usage of landing pages to collect sales leads and opt-in.


✅ Highly recommended for online entrepreneurs, SME, employees who wants to improve their social media strategies in their business.





Learn more here: http://bit.ly/csmmblobpro



Do take note that each class only caters to 20 pax. 


Limited Tickets Available!





Please make sure that you have your Singpass ID ready & 2FA activated. 


Do remember to BRING LAPTOP





For further enquries, you can email to: admin@blobproacademy.com

events.name: Conversations: You are the Universe
events.description:
Conversations: You are the Universe
Saturday, 1 April | 2 – 5pm
Expression Gallery, Level 4
Free. Register in the lobby.

Humanity has always sought to catalogue the heavens and make visible the invisible forces we yearn to understand. Virtually every culture known to anthropology has had a cosmology – a story of how the world began and continues, a fundamental sense of how its members came to exist, and an attempt to grasp its place in it and how its narrative fits into some larger picture. 
Turn your imagination to the cosmos at this Conversations programme and explore the universe through the lenses of art, cultural history, philosophy and science, held in conjunction with the opening of The Universe and Art as part of the Art and Science of Space season. The programme unfolds across a series of talks that investigates cosmology from different perspectives, looking at how we seek to understand and depict the universe.

Speakers include Honor Harger (Executive Director of ArtScience Museum), Nanjo Fumio (Director of Mori Art Museum), Tsubaki Reiko (Associate Curator at Mori Art Museum), Berlin-based artist Björn Dahlem, Slovenian theatre director Dragan Živadinov, Conan Cheong (Assistant Curator for Cross-Cultural Art at Asian Civilisations Museum), Yeow Kai Chai (Poet and Director of Singapore Writers Festival) and Lee Wei Fen (Associate Vice President, Ethnography at Quantum Singapore). 

#ASMuniverseandart

Programme schedule
2:00 – 2:05 Intro by ArtScience Museum 
2:05 – 2:15 Welcome note by Honor Harger, Executive Director of ArtScience Museum
2:15 – 2.25 Overview of The Universe and Art by Nanjo Fumio, Director of Mori Art Museum
2:25 – 2:40 Models of the cosmos and reimagining the ways the universe is understood, by artist Björn Dahlem
2:40 – 2:55 Devising choreography and theatre for the micro-gravity of space by Dragan Živadinov, Theatre director and artist
2:55 – 3:10 Q&A with Nanjo Fumio, Björn Dahlem and Dragan Živadinov, moderated by Honor Harger
3:10 – 3:25 Break
3:25 – 3:35 Welcome back note by Lee Wei Fen, Associate Vice President, Ethnography at Quantum Singapore
3:35 – 3:50 How humanity views, imagines and constructs understanding of the cosmos through highlights from The Universe and Art by Tsubaki Reiko, Associate Curator at Mori Art Museum
3:50 – 4:05 Cultural perspectives in cosmology across the centuries by Conan Cheong, Assistant Curator for Cross-Cultural Art at Asian Civilisations Museum
4:05 – 4:20 When the literary imagination meets the universe
by Yeow Kai Chai, Poet and Director of Singapore Writers Festival
4:20 – 4:35 Q&A with Tsubaki Reiko, Conan Cheong and Yeow Kai Chai, moderated by Lee Wei Fen
4:35 – 4:40 Outro by ArtScience Museum
